Data.text_description:
The probability of amount of money spent on advertising being high (A=1) is 0.5487. 
The probability of number of customers visiting the store being many (B=1) is 0.5078. 
For those with number of customers visiting the store being few (B=0) and amount of money spent on advertising being low (A=0), the probability of total sales revenue being high (C=1) is 0.5967. 
For those with number of customers visiting the store being few (B=0) and amount of money spent on advertising being high (A=1), the probability of total sales revenue being high (C=1) is 0.9420. 
For those with number of customers visiting the store being many (B=1) and amount of money spent on advertising being low (A=0), the probability of total sales revenue being high (C=1) is 0.8062. 
For those with number of customers visiting the store being many (B=1) and amount of money spent on advertising being high (A=1), the probability of total sales revenue being high (C=1) is 0.9786. 
For those with total sales revenue being low (C=0), the probability of profit generated by the store being high (D=1) is 0.6674. 
For those with total sales revenue being high (C=1), the probability of profit generated by the store being high (D=1) is 0.7294.
